narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Guilherme Medeiros DePaula  Gil

Instructor: Guilherme Medeiros DePaula  I approached Fjodor at first and he was very unhelpful and unwilling to assist. He referred me to Jonathan because i was new to using R software. Hence, i preferred waiting for Thursday for Jonathan's office hours at CSSI
Instructor: Guilherme Medeiros DePaula  Very helpful and responsive, a great TA.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Lily Zeng  helpful during office hours
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Very committed as a tutor.
Instructor: Yiming Hu  Yiming is the best!

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think many FES students might think that multivariate statistics is not relevant to their career goals. I highly disagree. Throughout classes and even in the workplace we are constantly challenged to analyze data and think critically about what it means. This class, although math-heavily at times, 100% stretches both of those skills. It has given me a great appreciation for acquiring, analyzing, and presenting data.

Jonathan is an excellent professor. In all honesty, I simply sat in on sessions that I found interesting or that were relevant for my particular research pursuits at any given time during the semester. My involvement was pretty minimal, but Jonathan's teaching style allows for this type of auditing. Thank you!

Jonathan is a fantastic and engaging lecturer about a topic that can sometimes be presented in a rather dry way. I feel like I'm walking away from this class with some really useful multivariate statistic skills.

Overall, i think you did an excellent job teaching the subject material. The thing I struggled with the most was applying the things we learned in class to the homework; partly because I struggled to use some of the computer programs, and partly because the outputs of those programs can be confusing. I almost feel like a flipped version of the class (or a partially flipped version) might be more useful; that students could spend time learning to use the programs with you and the TFs present to help.

Professor Reuning-Scherer is a great instructor, dedicated to the learning experience of his students. The pace is fast, but he makes himself available providing many opportunities for students to ask questions.

One problem I had with the course is that the TA's were not comfortable with the software (SAS) I was using. So when I ran up against problems I had to spend a lot of time trying to figure it out on my own or rely on the professor.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Jonathan is an excellent professor. I don't think I would have nearly the same evaluation for the same class taught by another professor. He is organized, responsive, funny, and really cares that you learn something from this course. Statistics can be a dry subject but he makes it interesting and entertaining.
The examples and illustration of the concepts
Lectures were useful, but Jonathan makes himself so available outside of class, which provides really useful one-on-one time for clarification and further teaching.
Jonathan's engaging and fun teaching style. I think he may be the best professor I have had in both undergrad and graduate school
Useful material.
I really enjoyed learning and applying advanced statistical techniques, and being able to use a data set of our choosing to complete assignments.

Jonathan is an engaging and hilarious lecturer, and it is clear he enjoys coming to class every day to teach us. He is also very helpful when when working on problem sets at office hours outside of class.
Homeworks were very useful to learn.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Not necessarily an improvement, but the lectures move quickly.

It will be great if the class is offered in a flip version and the actual class time is spent in the lab, working at the software and doing many of the examples in real time. Additional time and support for learning the software will be a great benefit as well.

Professor cares about his students, but he often speaks and explains things too swiftly. I found it hard to keep up and felt lectures were often over my head. Very easy to get lost in lecture if you are not a quantitatively-inclined person / don't have quant background.
I would have appreciated additional time spent on structural equation modeling.
We went through the material really quickly, which was compounded by the speed at which Jonathan talks!
I personally did not like the teaching style of the Professor.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Helps with analysis of environmental data
It helps me build the arsenal of statistical tools that I'm hoping to gain from grad school!

I use a lot of multivariate techniques in my research, so its was good to know not only how to do the analyses that I want to do, but also what other analyses I could be doing that might find some interesting trends in my data

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I really enjoyed the FES Intro to Stats from last semester and wanted to further my interest in the subject.
I need to have a broader view of data analysis and needed to know how to use SPSS and R statistical software
I wanted to broaden the tools I had in analytical methods.
I wanted to be able to analyze data that I collected using more than univariate techniques.
To learn multivariate stats
I wanted to improve my statistical skills for analyzing health-related data sets.
Learn to interpret multivariate data in innovative ways, and understand how statistical results related to this type of data are obtained.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Exceeded, definitely. I now know a few statistical packages. On day 1 I had no idea how to use anything other than Minitab.
Yes

Yes. While I'm not sure I'll use all methods we discussed in the future, I think having been exposed to them will help me in different contexts (reading papers, understanding methods, etc) and many of them may be applicable.
Yes, and then some. I can't believe how much material we covered.
how to do multivariate stats
Yes, they met my expectations.
Yes, definitely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: You are allowed to work together or alone on homework or the final project and that really helped - especially because you could run into technical code issues.
My group mate slacked off a lot, so I ended up doing most of the work, but I suppose these things happen.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Attend every lecture and pay attention. Jonathan provides really excellent notes for every class. Also, the class is recorded. I would 100% recommend watching the videos again before completing the homework. You will get much more out of it and refresh your memory. The lectures move quickly - he packs a lot into the time so the videos are a lifesaver!
Jonathan makes the course interesting and he provides enough assistance for assignements

You will be introduced to many multivariate methods in this class! How much you get out of them will depend a lot on how you much you put into them, but there's potential to learn a lot in this course.
Keep up with the work, and don't be afraid to go to office hours for help.

Practice often; do not be late on the HW assignments; ask questions regularly. You should only take this class if you really are doing research and data analysis at the time; otherwise the class is hard and if you do not apply the concepts, it can end up being somewhat theoretical.
I would definitely recommend this course if you are looking to learn new multivariate analysis techniques which can be used with a wide variety of datasets.
Great class! Definitely take it.
Endure.
